content.description: Sit down start on the right side of a fairly large boulder, with a rail and the prow for hands. Move up to a good jug, then continue trending left up the arete to top out.
content.location: This boulder is located in the large cluster of boulders west/downslope of the main area on the north side of the trail from Hanger 18 parking, before reaching the obvious trailside bloc of Black Angus. If you are looking at Black Angus, it will be back and to your left. It will be beside two other very large boulders, but will have noticeably more overhang than either. Located near The Press and the easy v1 roof.

content.description: Short and easy roof climb. Get as low as you can to SDS on good sidepulls/underclings, then fire out, up , and over on jugs. Not much to it, but it is one of the few easy roof climbs (nearly horizontal) to be found at Haycock.
content.protection: A pad or two should do.
content.location: This is located left of the main Hanger 18 area in the next group of boulders downslope/west from Black Angus (back and to your left if you're looking straight at the aforementioned problem). It is north of the trail to the Hanger 18 parking area, and you would pass it before arriving at Black Angus. It is the furthest of the boulders in this cluster, but should be pretty easy to spot.

content.description: S.D.S. matched on a protruding hold down low. Use a couple incut sidepulls to reach a jug on the lip. Top-out directly above.
content.location: Left of Hanger 18. This problem is facing "The Press", about 20' away.

content.description: SDS with a jug on the prow. The right arete is off. Reach up to an edge, then to the terrible flat gaston sloper. Match it, and continue up edges on the left face.
content.location: Left of Hanger 18. When the trail cuts right (near Of Mice and Men), cut left and head into the small corridor of boulders that mark the left boundary of Hanger 18.

content.description: SDS at the base of the blunt arete. Work up into underclings and then the seam above. Get your feet way up and make a huge reach to a good hold at the lip the boulder.
content.protection:
2-3 Pads. 

  This has an awkward landing. Its best to bring a few pads to stack the landing.
content.location: As soon as you reached the huge downed tree that is now a marked feature of Hanger 18, look ahead and to the left of the downed tree. Its just a bit left of Rodeo Arete.

content.description: Start on underclings and move up left to a series of good sidepulls.
content.location: A few feet left of "Of Mice and Men".
